intro: Anemopaegma triplinervium, commonly known as the three-veined anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with three prominent veins. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
